Create a butterfly plot for Early Development Visualization

g_butterfly.Rd

Create a butterfly plot for Early Development Visualization

g_butterfly(category, groups, block_count = "# of patients",
  block_color = NULL, id, facet_rows = NULL, x_label = block_count,
  y_label = "AE Derived Terms", legend_label = "AETOXGR",
  sort_by = "alphabetical", show_legend = TRUE)

Arguments

category

vector of y values
groups

vector of dichotomization values
block_count

string - what to count by (ex: # of AEs or # of patients)
block_color

vector - color coding of bar segments
id

unique subject identifier variable.
facet_rows

vector defines what variable is used to split the plot into rows, default here is NULL
x_label

string of text for x axis label, default is block_count
y_label

string of text for y axis label, default is AE Derived Terms
sort_by

character string that defines the ordering of the class and term variables in the output table, options: "alphabetical" or "count", default here is set to "count"
show_legend

boolean of whether color coding legend is included, default here is FALSE

Value

ggplot object

Examples

library(random.cdisc.data)
library(plyr)
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> You have loaded plyr after dplyr - this is likely to cause problems.
#> If you need functions from both plyr and dplyr, please load plyr first, then dplyr:
#> library(plyr); library(dplyr)
#> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘plyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:dplyr’:
#> 
#>     arrange, count, desc, failwith, id, mutate, rename, summarise,
#>     summarize
library(dplyr)
library(lemon)
library(reshape2)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘reshape2’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:tidyr’:
#> 
#>     smiths
library(grid)
library(gtable)
library(stringr)

data <- left_join(radam("AAE", N=10),radam("ADSL", N=10))
#> Joining, by = c("STUDYID", "USUBJID")
#data <- data %>% filter(AEBODSYS %in% c("Vascular disorders", "Surgical and medical procedures"))

g_butterfly(category = data$AEBODSYS,
            groups = data$SEX,
            block_count = "# of patients",
            block_color = data$AETOXGR,
            id = data$USUBJID,
            facet_rows = data$RACE,
            x_label = "# of patients",
            y_label = "AE Derived Terms",
            legend_label = "AETOXGR",
            sort_by = "count",
            show_legend = TRUE)
#> Joining, by = c("y", "groups", "f_rows")
#> Joining, by = "y"
